quickly went from standing to lying facedown

tn.ref: We have been unfaithful to our God
tn.text: This was made as a public confession, not as a boastful claim.

tn.ref: Anyone who did not come ... forfeited all of his possessions and would be excluded
tn.text: "The officials would take all the possessions away from anyone who did not come ... and would excuse them" or "The people of Judah and Jerusalem would take all the possessions away from anyone who did not come ... and would exclude them"

tn.ref: ninth month and the twentieth day of the month
tn.text: This is the ninth month of the Hebrew calendar. The twentieth day is near the middle of December on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
a large open courtyard in front of the temple
The abstract noun "treason" can be translated as a verb. AT: "helped the enemies of your people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: so as to increase Israel's guilt
tn.text: "and now God considers us guilty of worse sin than before"
move away from, be different from

tn.ref: this is not only one or two days of work
tn.text: This litotes can be translated in positive form. AT: "we will need a long time to do all this work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: the time that will be fixed with the city elders and the city judges
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the time that the city elders and city judges will fix" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Jonathan ... Asahel ... Jahzeiah ... Tikvah ... Meshullam ... Shabbethai
Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah opposed this
tn.text: Possible meanings are, 1) these men did not want the city officials to investigate the offenses or 2) they did not want anyone to investigate the people's marriages.
The people investigated who had married non-Jewish wives.

tn.ref: the first day of the tenth month
tn.text: This is the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the middle of December on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
